bio.title: About
content: I’m Claudio Vallejo, a Mexican web designer and front-end developer from Matamoros, Tamaulipas. I'm currently freelancing from Monterrey, Nuevo Leon and looking for a job opportunity in the United States as a Product Designer working on design systems or business tools with global impact.

I first learned about design as a senior at Baylor University, where I designed my first logo as part of the Baylor Accelerated Ventures Program. During my last semester I took an intro to media design course where I worked on my first freelance project and designed my first website. I decided to pursue a career as a graphic designer after graduating with a BBA in Entrepreneurship in May 2014.

I moved to Phoenix, Arizona August 2014 with one of my best friends to start a video production company. I lived in Phoenix for 9 months where I learned more about business and graphic design and worked for Brushfire Interactive as a freelance motion designer.

My student Visa expired and I moved to Monterrey where I worked for Parámetro Studio as a junior web designer the fall of 2015. During 2016 I freelanced as a web designer/developer for local businesses, continued freelancing with Brushfire as a motion designer, and participated in several design events in the US.

My goals for the near future are to join a design team in the US solving global business problems, be a part of and contribute to the design community, learn more about JavaScript development, and become a US citizen.
